thread.title: Chiefs tame Lions anew
thread.title_full: Chiefs tame Lions anew | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: Chiefs tame Lions anew
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 2, 2015 (updated) Games Today
(The Arena, San Juan)
12 noon – San Sebastian vs JRU
2 p.m. – EAC vs Mapua
4 p.m. – Perpetual vs Letran
Arellano University put another twist to an already complicated Final Four race by stalling San Beda College’s entry with a 91-72 rout yesterday at The Arena in San Juan.
While it derailed San Beda’s outright semis bid, Arellano kept its own bid alive – big thanks to veteran guard Jiovanni Jalalon.
Jalalon, who also starred in the team’s thrilling 88-84 win over the Lions in the first round, finished with 25 points, eight assists, seven rebounds and two steals to carry the Chiefs anew after back to back losses to Mapua (81-76) and Letran (87-81).
The 5-foot-10 Jalalon sparked a massive 23-6 run bridging the third to fourth periods with a devastating mix of jumpers to turn a precarious 54-50 lead into a commanding 77-57 advantage early in the last frame.
More than that, Arellano tied University of Perpetual Help and Jose Rizal University for third to fifth places at 11-6.
The Chiefs must beat the Emilio Aguinaldo College Generals on Tuesday to boost their Final Four bid.
As things stand, Arellano has a solid chance of earning a Final Four berth since the Generals are languishing at the cellar with a 2-14 record.
With San Beda absorbing its fifth defeat in 17 games, idle Letran regained the lead once again with its 12-4 mark.
Letran must beat Perpetual today to secure a Final Four berth.
Meantime, College of St. Benilde survived Lyceum’s late uprising to pull off a vengeful 59-56 win in a battle of two also-ran teams.
